title: unicode: U+0000 is not in Cc
body:
The first line of [UnicodeData.txt][data] defines U+0000 as being in category Cc. But package unicode seems to [disagree][table], as confirmed by this program:

```Go
package main

import (
        "fmt"
        "unicode"
)

func main() {
        fmt.Println(unicode.In(0, unicode.Cc))
}
```

Given the provenance of this package and the fact that tables.go is auto-generated, I'm sure I've missed something. What's the reason for rune zero not being in `Cc`?

[data]: http://www.unicode.org/Public/7.0.0/ucd/UnicodeData.txt
[table]: https://github.com/golang/go/blob/master/src/unicode/tables.go#L82-L88
